intro: Campylocentrum jamaicense, commonly known as the Jamaican starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant produces small, yellow-orange berries that are edible and have a sweet, tangy flavor. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are typically pink or purple. Campylocentrum jamaicense thrives in tropical climates and is often found in humid, well-drained soils.
